intro: Hieracium anchusoides subsp. floccipedunculoides, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually hairy and lobed, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
